meta.name: EFL Exercise Progression Law
meta.authority: Austin Lawrence, Director of Performance Systems
meta.purpose: Deterministic enforcement of safe exercise progression across all populations, sports, and training phases
meta.codexReference: §5.2 Exercise Selection & Progression, Governance v4.0, Load Standards v2.1.2

core_principle.definition: Only one exercise attribute may increase in complexity during any single progression step. All other attributes must remain constant or regress.
core_principle.rationale: Simultaneous progression on multiple axes exponentially increases injury risk, overwhelms motor learning capacity, and prevents accurate identification of limiting factors.
core_principle.violation_consequence: PROGRESSION_REJECTED — Must revert to legal single-axis change
core_principle.override_authority: Director approval required with documented rationale

progression_validation_algorithm.description: EPA and Coach AI must execute this logic before approving any exercise progression

steps.action: Compare current_exercise attributes to proposed_exercise attributes
Count number of axes where proposed > current
Validate population ceiling on progressed axis
steps.logic: IF proposed_value > population_ceiling THEN progression = ILLEGAL

steps.action: Check regression triggers for current exercise
steps.logic: IF any_regression_trigger_present THEN progression = FORBIDDEN (must regress instead)

steps.action: Validate consolidation duration at current level

load_band.description: Progressive increase in external resistance (bodyweight → bands → dumbbells → barbells → heavy barbell)

progression_sequence.description: Bodyweight only, no external load
Light external load (bands, light DBs, bodyweight variations)
Moderate external load (moderate DBs, KBs, landmine)
Heavy external load (barbell 70-85% 1RM, heavy DBs)
Maximal external load (barbell 85-100% 1RM)

Youth_8_12.rationale: Structural immaturity forbids maximal loading. Band_2 requires direct coaching supervision and proven technique.

Youth_13_17.rationale: Most youth operate Band_1-2. Band_3 reserved for advanced athletes with 2+ years training age and documented technique.

Adult.rationale: Full access to load spectrum with proper technique and readiness.

regression_triggers.definition: Loss of postural control, compensatory movement patterns, or inability to maintain prescribed tempo
regression_triggers.action: Regress 1 band immediately

regression_triggers.definition: Readiness score <8.0 indicating insufficient recovery or elevated stress
regression_triggers.action: Reduce load band by 1 (YELLOW) or 2 (RED)

regression_triggers.definition: Sharp, localized pain during exercise execution (not delayed soreness)
regression_triggers.action: Regress to pain-free load band or substitute exercise

regression_triggers.definition: Bar speed or movement velocity drops >20% within set
regression_triggers.action: Reduce load or terminate set

notes: Load band progression is ALWAYS slower than other axes
Tissue adaptation lags motor learning by 4-6 weeks
Youth populations require conservative load progression regardless of perceived strength

e_node_difficulty.description: Progressive increase in stretch-shortening cycle intensity, reactive demands, and elastic loading

progression_sequence.description: No elastic component, no impact loading, pure concentric or isometric
Low-amplitude elastic work, bilateral landing, stick emphasis
Moderate-amplitude elastic work, continuous rhythm allowed, bilateral emphasis
High-amplitude or high-velocity elastic work, reactive emphasis, unilateral allowed
Maximal elastic loading, shock method, unilateral reactive emphasis

Youth_8_12.rationale: Growth plate vulnerability and neuromuscular immaturity forbid high-shock loading. E3/E4 requires Director override with documented readiness.

Youth_13_17.rationale: Tier 3 (E3/E4) allowed but must not exceed 40% of session contacts. Majority must be Tier 1-2.
Youth_13_17.tier_3_calculation: IF session has 120 contacts, max 48 can be E3/E4. Remaining 72+ must be E0-E2.

Adult.rationale: Full access to elastic spectrum with proper progression and landing quality.

regression_triggers.definition: Loud landings, asymmetric force absorption, or loss of postural control on landing
regression_triggers.action: Regress to lower e-node level (E3→E2, E2→E1)

regression_triggers.definition: Medial knee collapse during landing or takeoff phase
regression_triggers.action: IMMEDIATE regression to bilateral E1 work. Do not progress until corrected.

regression_triggers.definition: Patellar, Achilles, or plantar fascia irritation lasting >24 hours post-session
regression_triggers.action: Reduce e-node by 1-2 levels and/or reduce contact volume by 30%

regression_triggers.definition: Contact time increases >50ms from baseline on reactive movements
regression_triggers.action: Reduce reactivity demand (E3→E2) or reduce volume

regression_triggers.definition: Jump height decreases >15% from rep 1 to rep 10 in continuous work
regression_triggers.action: Terminate set, reduce e-node next session

example_illegal.correction: Reduce tier_3_contacts to ≤48 or increase tier_1_2_contacts

notes: E-node progression requires landing quality maintenance as absolute prerequisite
Tier 3 work (E3/E4) is earned, not prescribed by calendar
Youth populations prioritize landing robustness over elastic output

stance_complexity.description: Progressive reduction in base of support from bilateral → split → unilateral

progression_sequence.description: Two feet in contact simultaneously, symmetrical loading
Asymmetrical stance (lunge position, staggered), both feet in contact
Single leg support, contralateral leg non-weight-bearing

Split_Stance.prerequisite: Bilateral movements must be pain-free, controlled, and demonstrate no compensatory patterns for minimum 4 weeks
screening_criteria: Bilateral squat depth to parallel without compensation
Bilateral landing with quiet, symmetrical force absorption
No knee valgus on bilateral patterns

Unilateral.prerequisite: Split stance movements must show no valgus, excessive hip drop, or trunk lateral shift for minimum 4 weeks
screening_criteria: Split squat to depth without knee valgus
Lunge pattern without excessive forward lean or trunk shift

regression_triggers.definition: Medial knee collapse on split or unilateral movements
regression_triggers.action: IMMEDIATE regression to bilateral. Do not progress until valgus eliminated.

regression_triggers.definition: Contralateral hip drops >10 degrees below parallel on unilateral work
regression_triggers.action: Regress to split stance, emphasize hip stability drills

regression_triggers.definition: Excessive lateral trunk flexion to maintain balance
regression_triggers.action: Regress stance complexity, add anti-lateral-flexion work

regression_triggers.definition: Unable to complete 80% of prescribed reps without touching down or losing position
regression_triggers.action: Regress to previous stance level

notes: Stance progression is independent of load band (can use light load on unilateral before heavy load on bilateral)
Basketball/court athletes may progress stance faster than load due to sport demands
Unilateral work reveals asymmetries masked by bilateral patterns

reactivity_level.description: Progressive reduction in ground contact time and increase in elastic recoil intent

progression_sequence.description: Land and hold position 2-3 seconds with no bounce, emphasize control
Land and immediately transition to next rep with controlled, rhythmic cadence
Minimize ground contact time (<250ms), maximize elastic recoil, true reactive emphasis

regression_triggers.definition: Audibly loud or heavy landings indicating poor force absorption
regression_triggers.action: Regress to Stick_Landing emphasis

regression_triggers.definition: Contact time increases beyond target range
regression_triggers.action: Reduce reactivity demand or terminate reactive work

regression_triggers.definition: Loss of trunk control, forward lean, or hip collapse during landing
regression_triggers.action: Regress to Continuous_Rhythm or Stick_Landing

regression_triggers.definition: Jump height or distance decreases >10% during reactive sets
regression_triggers.action: Reduce reactivity demand or extend rest periods

notes: Reactivity is the last axis to progress - it assumes mastery of landing mechanics
True reactive work (Level 3) is performance output, not foundational training
Most youth athletes benefit from extended time at Continuous_Rhythm before reactive work

direction_complexity.description: Progressive addition of movement planes and directional complexity

progression_sequence.description: Forward-backward movement only, single plane, predictable
Side-to-side movement, frontal plane emphasis
Rotational movement, transverse plane emphasis
Combination of planes, direction changes, sport-specific chaos

Youth_8_12.rationale: Multi-directional and reactive COD require decision-making capacity and neuromuscular control beyond developmental readiness of 8-12 population

Youth_13_17.rationale: Full direction access allowed, but reactive (unplanned) COD requires coach supervision and movement quality prerequisites
reactive_cod_prerequisites: Planned COD at all angles performed cleanly for 6+ weeks
No knee valgus on direction changes

Adult.rationale: Full access to all direction complexity levels with proper progression

regression_triggers.definition: Athlete hesitates, stutters, or shows uncertainty during direction changes
regression_triggers.action: Simplify direction complexity (multi → single plane)

regression_triggers.definition: Trunk control degrades when planes are added
regression_triggers.action: Regress to simpler direction pattern, add anti-rotation work

regression_triggers.definition: Unable to decelerate efficiently when direction complexity increases
regression_triggers.action: Regress to Linear or Lateral only, emphasize deceleration drills

notes: Basketball/court sports require faster progression through direction complexity than linear sports
Multi-directional work is game-specific, not foundational
Direction complexity often correlates with cognitive load - account for decision fatigue

non_axis_variables.description: Training variables that can be modified WITHOUT counting as axis progression
non_axis_variables.clarification: The following variables may change independently and do NOT trigger ONE_AXIS_AT_A_TIME restrictions. However, they still affect training load and must be managed appropriately.

tempo.rationale: Tempo modifies internal load and time under tension but does not fundamentally change movement complexity or external demand class
tempo.governance_note: While tempo is not an axis, excessive tempo manipulation can increase injury risk. Use sparingly and with clear intent.

rest_period.governance_note: Rest periods affect CNS load category but do not constitute exercise progression

set_count.governance_note: Volume increases must respect weekly contact and CNS budget caps

rep_count_within_band.definition: Repetitions per set when load band remains constant
rep_count_within_band.example: Band_1 Goblet Squat 3×8 → 3×12 does NOT count as axis change
rep_count_within_band.governance_note: Rep increases that necessitate load reduction DO constitute axis change (regression)

movement_pattern_refinement.definition: Subtle pattern variations that do not change fundamental movement class

examples.note: These refine quality/intent but do not change load_band, stance, direction, or reactivity

movement_pattern_refinement.governance_note: Pattern refinements are coaching tools, not progression steps

consolidation_duration_hierarchy.description: Clarification of minimum legal consolidation vs recommended adaptation windows

hierarchy.definition: Shortest duration athlete must remain at current exercise level before ANY progression is legal
hierarchy.enforcement: HARD_GATE - EPA will reject progressions attempted <2 weeks
hierarchy.applies_to: All axes, all populations, all seasons

hierarchy.definition: Typical duration for tissue/neural adaptation to consolidate at current level
hierarchy.enforcement: SOFT_GUIDANCE - Coaches should follow but may adjust based on athlete response

consolidation_duration_hierarchy.clarification: 2 weeks is NEVER sufficient adaptation time - it is only the minimum legal gate. Coaches and EPA should default to axis-specific recommended durations unless athlete demonstrates exceptional mastery and has Director approval for accelerated progression.
consolidation_duration_hierarchy.override_protocol: Progression between 2 weeks and axis-specific recommended duration requires documented rationale and movement quality verification

basketball_reference_progressions.description: Validated basketball-specific progressions following ONE_AXIS_AT_A_TIME law

vertical_jump_progression.prerequisite: Level 1 completed with excellent landing quality
Level 2 completed, landing quality maintained at Continuous rhythm
Level 3 completed, single-leg squat quality ≥7/10, no knee valgus

vertical_jump_progression.correct_approach: Split into two steps: (A) Depth Jump 45cm Continuous for 4 weeks, THEN (B) Depth Jump 45cm Reactive

deceleration_progression.note: Increased velocity = increased eccentric demand = E1

deceleration_progression.prerequisite: No knee valgus on bilateral work, single-leg squat quality ≥7/10

deceleration_progression.correct_approach: Must split into separate steps: (A) Level 4 → Add direction complexity first (45-degree cut, bilateral, stick), (B) Then add e_node difficulty (45-degree cut, bilateral, continuous), (C) Then maintain at unilateral

lateral_bound_progression.note: Greater lateral distance = higher force demand = E2

lateral_bound_progression.prerequisite: Single-leg squat quality ≥7/10, no knee valgus

lateral_bound_progression.correct_approach: Split into: (A) Lateral Bound Unilateral Continuous (E2, Continuous), THEN (B) Add reactivity after 4-6 weeks

upper_body_shooting_compatible_progressi.note: Added scapular protraction at top = pattern refinement (see non_axis_variables). No formal axis changed.
Eccentric emphasis via tempo change (see non_axis_variables). Arm deceleration strength emphasis.
External load added, submaximal only for shooting compatibility
upper_body_shooting_compatible_progressi.shooting_compatibility_rule: Never exceed 80% 1RM, avoid soreness before shooting practice

epa_integration_rules.description: How EPA must use this law during session generation
epa_integration_rules.validation_checkpoint: BEFORE exercise is added to session plan

validation_steps.action: Retrieve athlete's current_exercise_level for given pattern
validation_steps.data_source: Athlete training history or ICP defaults

validation_steps.action: Compare current_exercise to proposed_exercise across all 5 axes
IF axes_changed > 1 THEN reject_progression AND provide_legal_alternative
IF axes_changed = 1 THEN validate_population_ceiling on progressed axis
IF population_ceiling violated THEN reject AND suggest legal exercise at ceiling

validation_steps.logic: IF any trigger present (readiness, movement quality) THEN forbid progression, require regression

output_on_rejection.legal_alternative: Exercise that changes only 1 axis within population ceiling

example.proposed: Single-Leg Box Jump 45cm Reactive (E3, Unilateral, Reactive)
example.rejected_because: THREE axes changed from current level (E2, Bilateral, Continuous)
example.legal_alternative_step_1: Single-Leg Box Jump 30cm Continuous (E2, Unilateral, Continuous) - Only stance changed
example.legal_alternative_step_2: After 6 weeks at Step 1, progress to Box Jump 45cm Continuous (E3, Unilateral, Continuous) - Only e-node changed
example.legal_alternative_step_3: After 4 weeks at Step 2, progress to Box Jump 45cm Reactive (E3, Unilateral, Reactive) - Only reactivity changed

coach_playbook_integration.section_reference: Coach AI Playbook v0.5.0, Section 3.4: Exercise Progression Law

coach_decision_tree.question_1: Is athlete performing current exercise with excellent technique for 2+ weeks consistently?
coach_decision_tree.if_no: DO NOT PROGRESS. Focus on quality at current level. Consider regression if technique degrading.

coach_decision_tree_2.question_2: Select ONE axis to progress. Which is the most appropriate next step for this athlete?
coach_decision_tree_2.guidance: Choose based on sport demands and athlete limiters. Basketball typically prioritizes: e_node → stance → direction → reactivity → load.

coach_decision_tree_3.question_3: After 2-4 weeks at new level, has technique quality remained excellent?
coach_decision_tree_3.if_no: REGRESSION required. Return to previous level on progressed axis. Investigate limiter.
coach_decision_tree_3.if_yes: Consolidate for 2 more weeks before considering next progression step.

reason_codes.PROGRESSION_APPROVED: Athlete met all criteria for single-axis progression within population ceiling
reason_codes.PROGRESSION_REJECTED_POPULATION_CEILING: Proposed exercise exceeds population ceiling on progressed axis
reason_codes.PROGRESSION_REJECTED_TECHNIQUE: Current exercise technique quality insufficient (<2 weeks excellent performance)
reason_codes.PROGRESSION_REJECTED_REGRESSION_TRIGGER: Active regression trigger present (readiness, movement quality, pain)
reason_codes.PROGRESSION_REJECTED_PREMATURE: Insufficient consolidation time at current level (<2 weeks)
reason_codes.PROGRESSION_FORBIDDEN_INJURY: Active injury contraindication for proposed progression
reason_codes.PROGRESSION_FORBIDDEN_READINESS: Readiness state (YELLOW/RED) forbids progression at this time

documentation_required: Reason for override (e.g., advanced athlete, sport-specific demand)

example_valid_override.athlete: Elite basketball player, 5+ years training age
example_valid_override.proposed: Simultaneous progression of e-node (E2→E3) and reactivity (Continuous→Reactive) for sport-specific transfer
example_valid_override.rationale: Athlete has mastered both axes independently, competitive season requires integrated reactive work
example_valid_override.monitoring: Daily landing quality checks, weekly jump testing, immediate regression if any degradation

changes: REQUIRED FIX: Added population_ceilings for direction_complexity axis (Youth 8-12 max: Lateral_Frontal, Youth 13-17: Multi_Directional with planned COD only, Adult: full access)
REQUIRED FIX: Added non_axis_variables section clarifying that tempo, rest, sets, reps are NOT formal axes
REQUIRED FIX: Added consolidation_duration_hierarchy clarifying 2 weeks = minimum legal (hard gate) vs axis-specific durations = recommended adaptation
